name: The Westin Peachtree Plaza

reviews.text: When the Peachtree Plaza hotel opened in the 1970's it was the tallest building in Atlanta and the tallest hotel in the world. The building now currently holds neither of those distinctions (it's the 4th tallest building in the city) but still stands high on my list.
reviews.title: A bed in the clouds

likes.disliked: — big hotel with only one restaurant.

reviews.title: Seen better days
reviews.text: I had eaten at the Sun Dial Restaurant at the top of the 73 story tall hotel a couple of times over the past 25 years but I had never actually been a guest and stayed in a room in all of my visits to Atlanta... but it was something I always had wanted to do. "One of these days, I'm going to stay up there." I would stay as I passed through town. On my recent visit I forked over the Starwood points and reserved a room for two nights.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was greeted promptly upon pulling in the auto entrance and the staff took care of my car and my luggage with a friendly smile. I took the escalator up to the fifth floor to check in. The lobby has undergone renovations over the years and much of the original John Portman design has diappeared -- there is no more lake in the lobby -- the current look of the lobby is modern and is in keeping with the overall "calm and relaxed" theme that Westin is advertising.
reviews.title: Not what it used to be!

reviews.text: I was given room 6212 with a great view of the East side of Atlanta. Actually if you looked from corner to corner of the window I was able to see everything from Stone Mountain up north down to the control tower at the airport down south.
reviews.title: Acceptable but not up to Westin quality
Westin Peachtree plaza Atlanta
reviews.text: The room was small with a low ceiling and if it had not had floor to ceiling, wall to wall glass on the exterior of the building it would have probably seemed cramped. The bathroom was very small with a very narrow door. The room did have everything expected of a modern hotel room including internet, mini bar, and coffee maker. The king room also had a small sofa in the corner. There some signs of items in the room showing some signs of wear but nothing was falling apart, worn out, or dirty.

My friends and i decided it would be fun to go to Atlanta to celebrate New Year's Eve and of course we figured that the Westin would be beautiful, comfortable and luxurious. Well, we figured wrong! This was probably the worst hotel I've experienced in my life. I think I will never again stay at a Westin. The hotel was dirty and filled to the brim with chick-fil-a bowl fans. If you wanted to get to your room, you had to be prepared to either wait 30 minutes for an elevator or walk 30 flights of stairs. Speaking of stairs, they are only big enough to fit one person single file down them. So, if there was ever a fire in this hotel, be prepared to see your life flashing before your eyes. The rooms are about the size of a small box. The view is OK, but honestly why would you want to look out your window onto a bunch of smoke stacks and dirty buildings. It was not a satisfying experience, to say the least.
reviews.title: New Year's Hell

likes.liked: — That we didn't have to pay full price for that POS room.
likes.disliked: — We asked to face the peach drop, didn't happen. There were loud obnoxious people everywhere. The hotel was understaffed. It was filthy. We had to request new sheets because ours were torn and dirty before we even got into the bed. Gross! It was a small hole in the wall room. People were smoking weed all over the hotel. You have to take a separate elevator to go to the sundial restaurant and it's always full. Not worth the time or money. I wouldn't pay $2 to stay here.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed in the Westin on New Years eve. We couldnt even park at the hotel! They said the didnt have anymore parking so we had to park at another parking garage. We got charged for 2 days even though we only stayed one night because we didnt get our car by 6 am, even though check out wasnt until 12 noon. The rooms were also not stocked properly. We paid 300 for that night and had to call for our robes, toilet paper, and towels. We will not be going back to this hotel again.
reviews.title: Did not enjoy stay

reviews.text: I stayed at this hotel for two days. This was my second stay at this hotel -- the prior being in 2006 for one week. Both stays were a solid experience. I would not give this hotel a top rating as the facility is older and needs a small amount of attention. Plus they could be better with follow-through, explained below.
reviews.title: Westin Peachtree is a Good Choice
Not good enough
reviews.text: When we explained to the front desk that we had recently had a bad experience at another Westin, and was hoping that this stay in Atlanta would improve our experience with Westin, we were offered some free wine to be sent to the room. However, this wine never arrived. I would have preferred to be offered nothing, than to be told something is coming, which did not. I would not expect this from a Westin.
I had breakfast one morning, and the buffet was nothing special at all in light of the price. Decent but not noteworthy.
reviews.title: Less than impressed

reviews.text: Although I had read reviews prior to checking in, I was still surprised at the conditions of the room floors and the rooms themselves. Once you leave the lobby, it doesn't appear that any renovations or repairs have been performed in years. I have stayed in far lesser hotel brands that were in far better shape. It's almost like maintenance chooses to ignore large chips in the hallway door frames, missing tiles, dirty grout, etc. Please note that it is not housekeeping - the room itself was very clean.
reviews.title: Not up to Westin standards

reviews.text: The hotel staff provided a lovely dose of Southern hospitality, the gym was very well-equipped, and room service was great. This hotel, with its historic 70's architecture and Starbucks on the premises, could be fabulous. Westin management should take note - this is the second Westin (see my Tucson La Paloma review) that I have stayed in that did not meet Westin standards. It is making me rethink future reservations.
reviews.title: Only stay here if absolutely necessary

reviews.text: I travel to Atlanta for work 50% of the year and often stay at the Westin because our office is across the street. The only thing this hotel has going for it is the location.... everything else about it --- TERRIBLE.
reviews.title: Just don't pay house rate!

reviews.text: There's no Starwood Platinum lounge, and they don't offer any breakfast/drink coupon to make up for it.
reviews.title: Slipped
It was nice
reviews.text: There's a Starbucks on the 5th floor lobby, and half of the time the charges there don't show up on the room bill!! On the other hand, minibar charges mysteriously show up on bills even when you don't have a key to the minibar.

Staying on the 43rd floor was dizzying. Floor to ceiling windows. You feel kind of like abird. It was clean, comfortable. The walls were a little thin so I could hear my neighbor's television. Water pressure was funky in the sink. Very accomodating for a 5 minute late checkout (I got lost). In the center of everything.
reviews.title: Dizzying but in a good way

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Good staff, great lobby area with a decent singer Friday night in the lounge. Furniture in room rickety and dated but carpet was ok, no bad smell,bed very comfortable, bathroom small but nice two-head shower. Requested and got a high floor facing south...great view. Had dinner across the street at Pittypat' s Porch and it was pitty-ful. Will definitely try this hotel agaion
reviews.title: Had no probem with this hotel

reviews.text: Not worth going out of your way for.
reviews.title: Usual nice bed - but tired old rooms

reviews.text: Its a huge impersonal hotel, which seems to be understaffed judging by how long it takes to check in / get any room service etc.
reviews.title: This place is falling apart.....literally!

likes.liked: — location to Americasmart is the only good thing this place has going for it
likes.disliked: — Everything else other than the location. Horrible run down dirty place!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Usual Westin refinements apply - great beds nice desk working area and so on - but the whole thing feels tired and needs some attention.
reviews.title: Slice of the 70's nice place for historical value

aka: The Westin Peachtree Plaza Hotel Atlanta
description: Connected to AmericasMart, The Westin Peachtree Plaza, is steps from CNN, Georgia Aquarium, Georgia World Congress Center and the Georgia Dome.
